stepAnswer: a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
stepTitle: Dependent personality disorder (DPD) is characterized by
choices: a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
a pervasive pattern of preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, and control
a pervasive pattern of social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy, and hypersensitivity to criticism or rejection
a pervasive and excessive need to be taken care of by others
an inflated sense of $$self-importance$$, a constant need for admiration and attention, and a lack of empathy for others
